title: orca-recovery-adapter Lambda Output
description: The output for the orca-recovery-adapter Lambda.

granules.description: A list of values representing the granules entered through input and their recovery status.

granuleId.description: The id of the granule being restored.

recoverFiles.description: A list of values representing each file that was requested for recovery.

errorMessage.description: If the restoration of the file errored, the error will be stored here.

completionTime.description: The time the restore was completed, in UTC and iso-format.

filename.description: Name of the granule file with no path.

keyPath.description: S3 key that includes the name of the file and path that is a part of the granule.

lastUpdate.description: The last time the file's status changed, in UTC and iso-format.

restoreDestination.description: The bucket the restored file will be moved to after the restore completes.

requestTime.description: The time the restore was requested, in UTC and iso-format.

statusId.description: The numerical status value that the file is in; 1 - pending or 3 - failed

success.description: Must be true, otherwise an exception will be raised.

s3MultipartChunksizeMb.description: The maximum chunk size that will be used when copying the file.

asyncOperationId.description: The 'job_id' from input event if present, otherwise a newly-generated uuid.
